extractFactDictList.question: What country was the first to have a highly developed state?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The formation of a highly developed state in Egypt began with the Naqada II culture of Upper Egypt and became more and more visible during Naqada III.

extractFactDictList.question: What type of state is forming?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The process of forming a unified Egyptian state can be observed primarily in Naqada mortuary practices, grave goods, tomb art and artifacts, and the material culture remains from economic activities.

extractFactDictList.question: When do most scholars believe that Narmer or Menes were the leaders of the time period?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Most scholars who study this period believe that sometime around the year 3100 BCE, a leader named either Narmer or Menes—sources are unclear on whether these were the same person!

extractFactDictList.question: What country did he control?
extractFactDictList.sentence: —united Egypt politically when he gained control of both Upper and Lower Egypt.

extractFactDictList.question: What period was the end of?
extractFactDictList.sentence: This unification marked the end of the Neolithic Period and the beginning of one of the world’s first two true civilizations.
